alert.note: Alert for Broward (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 01 at 3:45PM EDT by NWS Miami
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Florida, including the following counties, Broward and Palm Beach. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 345 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Coral Springs, Boca Raton, Deerfield Beach, Delray Beach, Highland Beach, Coconut Creek, Parkland, Hillsboro Beach, Boca Del Mar, Hamptons At Boca Raton, Whisper Walk, Kings Point, Boca Pointe, Mission Bay, Dunes Road, Gulf Stream, Boca West, Fau South Campus, Morikami Park and Sandalfoot Cove. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
